data:
Aaron Wynveen Aaron Wynveen Aaron Wynveen Teaching Associate Professor,
				School of Physics and Astronomy (612) 625-9072 wynveen@umn.edu Physics And Nanotechnology Building School of Physics and Astronomy, University of Minnesota [Ph.D. awarded, Thesis title: "Scattering Processes in Bose-Einstein Condensed Systems"] Physics Department, University of Michigan [M.S. awarded] Institute of Technology, University of Minnesota [B.S. in Physics (summa cum laude) awarded with minors in Mathematics and Mathematical Economic Theory] 2016-present: Teaching Associate Professor in the School of Physics and Astronomy at the University of Minnesota 2010 - 2016: Lecturer/Visiting Assistant Professor in the School of Physics and Astronomy at the University of Minnesota 2007 - 2009: Humboldt Fellow at the Institute for Theoretical Physics II, Heinrich-Heine University Duesseldorf, Germany 2003 - 2007: Postdoc in the Department of Chemistry, Imperial College London, United Kingdom Condensed matter, soft matter, and biophysical theory and computation.
